title: How to Decorate Simple Vases

methods.name: Decorating a plain vase with a mirror

steps.headline: Purchase broken mirror pieces from a craft or hardware store.
steps.description: You could also use broken mirror pieces that you might have at home but they need to be small pieces and not too sharp. Mirror pieces from the craft store will be in a safe mosaic form, already smoothed down for you.

steps.headline: Paste the small mirror pieces onto the vase.
steps.description: Use a glue gun or super glue to add the pieces to the vase. Use any pattern or random approach as wished. Allow to fully dry. Keep the mirror pieces as flat as possible, don't have any jagged edges sticking out from the vase.

steps.headline: Add paints or spray paints to add more decorative effects.

methods.name: Decorating a plain vase with different tapes

steps.headline: Use colorful tape.
steps.description: Washi tape is a good choice, or metallic tape.

steps.headline: Cut the tape into pieces.
steps.description:
Here you have several choices, such as:
Cut into squares for a mosaic tape appearance. Cut into tape lengths for making rows or lengths on the vase. Cut into shapes, such as circles or stars, for sticking on the vase.

steps.headline: Remove the backing from the tape.
steps.description: Adhere to the clean vase, taking care to stick to a pattern formation if following one. Otherwise, use a random mosaic style.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: It's a good idea to paint Mod Podge over the top, to act as a waterproof sealant.

methods.name: Decorating a plain vase with a woven mat

steps.headline: Find a few foam sheets.
steps.description: Choose the color that matches your décor.

steps.headline: Mark a one-inch line on one of the sheets, then cut slits in the sheet.
Insert a small length of foam sheet from the front, then from the top down, weaving in and out through the slits you've just cut.
steps.description: This will form a woven pattern.

steps.headline: Repeat this weaving pattern with other pieces also.
Paste the woven mat on the vase.
steps.description: Smooth it around the whole vase, then cut off any extra pieces.

text:
Decorating a plain vase with a mirror Purchase broken mirror pieces from a craft or hardware store. You could also use broken mirror pieces that you might have at home but they need to be small pieces and not too sharp. Mirror pieces from the craft store will be in a safe mosaic form, already smoothed down for you. Paste the small mirror pieces onto the vase. Use a glue gun or super glue to add the pieces to the vase. Use any pattern or random approach as wished. Allow to fully dry. Keep the mirror pieces as flat as possible, don't have any jagged edges sticking out from the vase. Add paints or spray paints to add more decorative effects. This step is optional. Use as required.  Decorating a plain vase with different tapes Use colorful tape. Washi tape is a good choice, or metallic tape. Cut the tape into pieces. Here you have several choices, such as:
Cut into squares for a mosaic tape appearance. Cut into tape lengths for making rows or lengths on the vase. Cut into shapes, such as circles or stars, for sticking on the vase. Remove the backing from the tape. Adhere to the clean vase, taking care to stick to a pattern formation if following one. Otherwise, use a random mosaic style. Done. It's a good idea to paint Mod Podge over the top, to act as a waterproof sealant. Decorating a plain vase with a woven mat Find a few foam sheets. Choose the color that matches your décor. Mark a one-inch line on one of the sheets, then cut slits in the sheet.  Insert a small length of foam sheet from the front, then from the top down, weaving in and out through the slits you've just cut. This will form a woven pattern. Repeat this weaving pattern with other pieces also.  Paste the woven mat on the vase. Smooth it around the whole vase, then cut off any extra pieces.
